title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1626-1.2 - Processing applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1626-1.2 - Processing applications

State Regulations
(a) Applications for public housing shall be processed for all site (or offsite)
tenants interested in public housing. In accordance with section
17
of the

Public Housing Law, these tenants have the highest priority for assignment, provided they are otherwise eligible for public housing. Section
153
of the

Public Housing Law, under certain circumstances, allows higher income levels
for determining eligibility of such tenants. (b) In cases of site and offsite tenants who
are not interested in public housing, a signed statement to that effect shall
be obtained. This statement does not nullify the tenant's assignment priority
in the event he should change his mind later, but it is a basis for the
authority to proceed in assignment of apartments to eligible applicants in the
next priority category. (c) Eligibility of site and offsite tenants can generally be ascertained prior to
the project's apartments being ready for occupancy. However, if all apartments
are ready for occupancy before offsite property is acquired, or if there are
delays in determining eligibility which are not attributable to site or offsite
tenants, the Bureau of Management should be advised so that plans for
accommodating such possible eligible families can be formulated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1626-1.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
